events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover unexpected medical expenses and debt consolidation.
Loan team categorized the application as a personal loan after reviewing the applicant's stated purpose for medical bills.
A loan officer was assigned to manage this personal loan application and guide the applicant through next steps.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the applicant’s financials, credit history, and loan purpose.
Applicant was asked to submit recent bank statements, proof of income, and documentation of medical expenses.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents including medical bills and pay stubs.
Credit check was completed showing a moderate credit score with some previous debt, consistent with applicant’s statement.
Risk team conducted an assessment highlighting the applicant’s ability to repay the personal loan despite some existing debts.
The personal loan offer was presented outlining interest rate, repayment schedule, and loan amount approval.
The applicant responded positively, agreeing to the loan terms and expressing readiness to proceed.
Loan was formally approved after verifying all requirements were met and applicant consented to terms.
Funds were disbursed to the applicant’s account to address medical expenses and consolidate debts as intended.
Follow-up call was conducted to confirm loan account setup and provide assistance with payment scheduling.
The personal loan application was officially closed after successful funding and completion of all internal processes.
